hackathon-description-text: Over 400 students from over 20 countries will gather for 36h of dreaming, hacking and shipping on anything and everything. All projects are welcome, mobile, hardware, web, you name it. Throughout the hackathon we'll have introductory talks for first time hackers as well as sponsor Tech Talks to help you out with your hacks!
hackathon-eligibility: Only hackers who recieved a ticket and confirmed attendance are eligible to participate in HackUPC. If you attended and hacked at HackUPC, then you are eligible to make a submission.
hackathon-rules:
Only teams of eligible participants that submit their hacks to this Devpost, and then demo their hack, can win prizes. 
- 
- All code must be fresh, done during the hacking period (12:00 AM Sat 12:00 PM Sun)
- You cannot steal another team's source code
- The decision of judges is final
hackathon-requirements: Hack, submit to Devpost and show your work during demo time from 12:30 PM - 2:00 PM at the venue. Only hacks who do demo are elligible for prizes. Build something awesome.
hackathon-description-header: BarcelonaTech's first collegiate Hackathon. 400 hackers. 36h. Dream it. Hack it. Ship it.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One year of Wolfram Development Platform, Developer Level.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative and Collaborative Social hack by Everis

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the hack do something new? Is it mindblowing?
Does everything appear to work? Is it well designed? Is the user experience good?
How technically interesting or difficult is the hack? Were there geniune technical problems to overcome?
Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need?
